body: Most of the problem is that these senators and representatives spend too much time in Washington.  Here's what they need to do....go there, vote, and the go back to your constituents. Spend time with them, learn what is important to them, rather than hobknob with elites, snobs, and lobbyists.

Spend time with them, learn what is important to them, rather than hobknob with elites, snobs, and lobbyists.

body:
The term "The Cathedral" is good for academic and internal discussions, but it's confusing for normies, so it's not as effective for propaganda use. Same with "The Party," as people will think you're discussing the Dems alone.

I like "The Regime," as in "regime change." It's simultaneously offensive, evocative, and correct.
body_html:
The term "The Cathedral" is good for academic and internal discussions, but it's confusing for normies, so it's not as effective for propaganda use. Same with "The Party," as people will think you're discussing the Dems alone.

I like "The Regime," as in "regime change." It's simultaneously offensive, evocative, and correct.

body: Yeah but I'm always the little guy who doesn't really do anything right. That's the most any of my idea posts ever get to, while other peoples' easily skyrocket super high. It's been a theme of my life, that any time I have any kind of goal it doesn't work out, things never fail to go impossibly wrong. Every. Single. Time. And I think the only explanation is that I suck that bad. I can try super hard at something for years and most other people still easily overcome almost every obstacle I face. It's probably because I don't have the right genes for intelligent endeavors, I'm a guy with a lineage of mostly simpler people. Which is fine but I unfortunately have no interest in that and I'm trying to succeed at things that simply don't match my skillset. Try what I like and be a miserable failure. Do what I'm made for and hate it. I'm doomed to hate my life either way.
body_html: Yeah but I'm always the little guy who doesn't really do anything right. That's the most any of my idea posts ever get to, while other peoples' easily skyrocket super high. It's been a theme of my life, that any time I have any kind of goal it doesn't work out, things never fail to go impossibly wrong. Every. Single. Time. And I think the only explanation is that I suck that bad. I can try super hard at something for years and most other people still easily overcome almost every obstacle I face. It's probably because I don't have the right genes for intelligent endeavors, I'm a guy with a lineage of mostly simpler people. Which is fine but I unfortunately have no interest in that and I'm trying to succeed at things that simply don't match my skillset. Try what I like and be a miserable failure. Do what I'm made for and hate it. I'm doomed to hate my life either way.

body: What's a good introduction to The Cathedral for the normies?
body_html: What's a good introduction to The Cathedral for the normies?

parent.body:
The term "The Cathedral" is good for academic and internal discussions, but it's confusing for normies, so it's not as effective for propaganda use. Same with "The Party," as people will think you're discussing the Dems alone.

I like "The Regime," as in "regime change." It's simultaneously offensive, evocative, and correct.
parent.body_html:
The term "The Cathedral" is good for academic and internal discussions, but it's confusing for normies, so it's not as effective for propaganda use. Same with "The Party," as people will think you're discussing the Dems alone.

I like "The Regime," as in "regime change." It's simultaneously offensive, evocative, and correct.
